dfischer.utils

Class VarInputFileReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.AbstractInputFileReader
      • dfischer.utils.VarInputFileReader

  • public class VarInputFileReader
extends AbstractInputFileReader
    Parses an ASCII text based input file and extracts on each input-line of the file one ore more variables, separated by a delimiter char.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class dfischer.utils.AbstractInputFileReader

        EOF_REOPEN_FILE, EOF_STOP_READ

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VarInputFileReader(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String commentTag, java.lang.String varDelimiter, int eofAction)
      Deprecated. 
      since V5.4-K, does not support exec agents that run in encrypted mode. Prepares an var input file for reading and opens the file.
      VarInputFileReader(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String commentTag, java.lang.String varDelimiter, int eofAction, int charEncodingIntValue)
      Deprecated. 
      since V5.4-K, does not support exec agents that run in encrypted mode. Prepares an var input file for reading by using a particular character set and opens the file.
      VarInputFileReader(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String commentTag, java.lang.String varDelimiter, int eofAction, java.lang.String charEncodingCharset)
      Deprecated. 
      since V5.4-K, does not support exec agents that run in encrypted mode. Prepares an var input file for reading by using a particular character set and opens the file.

      Prepares an var input file for reading and opens the file.
      VarInputFileReader(SymmetricEncryptContext decryptContext, java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String commentTag, java.lang.String varDelimiter, int eofAction, int charEncodingIntValue)
      Prepares an var input file for reading by using a particular character set and opens the file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VarInputFileReader

        public VarInputFileReader(SymmetricEncryptContext decryptContext,
                  java.lang.String filename,
                  java.lang.String commentTag,
                  java.lang.String varDelimiter,
                  int eofAction)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Prepares an var input file for reading and opens the file.
        Parameters:
        decryptContext - the context to decrypt the file, or null if the file is not encrypted
        filename - name of var input file
        commentTag - line comment tag to comment out input lines. All line chars behind the comment tag will not flow inside the var input.
        varDelimiter - delimiter char to separate the vars of each line. This string can be null or empty or usually contain one character (but cannot contain several characters)
        eofAction - end of file Action: use EOF_REOPEN_FILE or EOF_STOP_READ
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        Since:
        V5.4-K

      • VarInputFileReader

        public VarInputFileReader(SymmetricEncryptContext decryptContext,
                  java.lang.String filename,
                  java.lang.String commentTag,
                  java.lang.String varDelimiter,
                  int eofAction,
                  int charEncodingIntValue)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Prepares an var input file for reading by using a particular character set and opens the file.
        Parameters:
        decryptContext - the context to decrypt the file, or null if the file is not encrypted
        filename - name of var input file
        commentTag - line comment tag to comment out input lines. All line chars behind the comment tag will not flow inside the var input.
        varDelimiter - delimiter char to separate the vars of each line. This string can be null or empty or usually contain one character (but cannot contain several characters)
        eofAction - end of file Action: use EOF_REOPEN_FILE or EOF_STOP_READ
        charEncodingIntValue - int value of the character set
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        Since:
        V5.4-K
        See Also:
        HttpLoadTest.CHAR_ENCODING_OS_DEFAULT, HttpLoadTest.CHAR_ENCODING_ISO_8859_1, HttpLoadTest.CHAR_ENCODING_UTF_8

      • VarInputFileReader

        public VarInputFileReader(SymmetricEncryptContext decryptContext,
                  java.lang.String filename,
                  java.lang.String commentTag,
                  java.lang.String varDelimiter,
                  int eofAction,
                  java.lang.String charEncodingCharset)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Prepares an var input file for reading by using a particular character set and opens the file.
        Parameters:
        decryptContext - the context to decrypt the file, or null if the file is not encrypted
        filename - name of var input file
        commentTag - line comment tag to comment out input lines. All line chars behind the comment tag will not flow inside the var input.
        varDelimiter - delimiter char to separate the vars of each line. This string can be null or empty or usually contain one character (but cannot contain several characters)
        eofAction - end of file Action: use EOF_REOPEN_FILE or EOF_STOP_READ
        charEncodingCharset - name of the character set. Examples: ISO-8859-1, UTF-8, null = use OS default
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        Since:
        V5.4-K

        public VarInputFileReader(java.lang.String filename,
                  java.lang.String commentTag,
                  java.lang.String varDelimiter,

    • Method Detail

      • setTrimValues

        public void setTrimValues(boolean trimValues)
        Set if white spaces at the start and at the end of the extracted values should be removed. Default = yes.

      • getNextLine

        public boolean getNextLine()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Gets the next valid var input line and parses the vars of this line. Skips automatically empty or fully commented out lines.
        Specified by:
        getNextLine in class AbstractInputFileReader
        Returns:
        false at EOF if EOF_STOP_READ was set on the constructor parameter eofAction, otherwise returns always true.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        AbstractInputFileReader.getLineVarCount(), AbstractInputFileReader.getLineVar(int), AbstractInputFileReader.EOF_REOPEN_FILE, AbstractInputFileReader.EOF_STOP_READ

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the input file. Hint: the input file is automatically closed if EOF_STOP_READ was set on the constructor parameter eofAction and EOF occurs. However if the EOF_REOPEN_FILE option is used or EOF never has been occurred the input file should be closed by calling this method.

      • getFilename

        public java.lang.String getFilename()
        Get the name of the file - as passed by the constructor.
        Returns:
        the name of the file
